content: Any tips on how to prevent timeout or memory issues when trying to output lots on information with Devel's dpm()? I need to output the array(s) before I can see what the keys/values are in order to narrow down what I'm looking for. Problem is it's just too big to output initially so I can't even start filtering what I'm looking for...
I know D8 has a settings where you can tell it how many 'levels' in an array or object to display for better performance. Does Backdrop have that?
Well no wonder! Discovered the dd() function which writes variables to a file in the temp directory. That file is almost 400MB!

I have no tricks for dpm(), but you could use debug() in code directly:

Huge objects (nodes/views):
debug(array_keys(get_object_vars($node)));

Huge forms:
debug(element_children($form));

Huge arrays:
debug(array_keys($whatever));
If you want to use debug(), you have to select the "All messages" at admin/config/development/logging

Experienced this issue again. Opened an issue for Devel to hopefully find a way to fix this: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/devel/issues/104
